bugs.title: CVE-2023-6879 chromium: aom: heap-buffer-overflow on frame size change [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-6879 chromium: aom: heap-buffer-overflow on frame size change [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-6879 aom: heap-buffer-overflow on frame size change

long_desc.thetext:
Increasing the resolution of video frames, while performing a multi-threaded encode, can result in a heap overflow in av1_loop_restoration_dealloc().

https://aomedia.googlesource.com/aom/+/refs/tags/v3.7.1
https://crbug.com/aomedia/3491

Created aom tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2256054]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2256055]


Created chromium tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2256056]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2256057]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2256053

bugs.title: CVE-2023-7104 chromium: sqlite: heap-buffer-overflow at sessionfuzz [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-7104 chromium: sqlite: heap-buffer-overflow at sessionfuzz [epel-all]

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in SQLite SQLite3 up to 3.43.0 and classified as critical. This issue affects the function sessionReadRecord of the file ext/session/sqlite3session.c of the component make alltest Handler. The manipulation leads to heap-based buffer overflow. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. The associated identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-248999.

https://sqlite.org/forum/forumpost/5bcbf4571c
https://sqlite.org/src/info/0e4e7a05c4204b47
https://vuldb.com/?ctiid.248999
https://vuldb.com/?id.248999

bugs.title: CVE-2024-0222 chromium: Use after free in ANGLE, compromised the renderer process to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page [epel-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-0222 chromium: Use after free in ANGLE, compromised the renderer process to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page [epel-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-0222 chromium: Use after free in ANGLE, compromised the renderer process to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page

long_desc.thetext:
Use after free in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 120.0.6099.199 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/01/stable-channel-update-for-desktop.html
https://crbug.com/1501798
